artist: Construct Studios; William Gray Purcell; George Grant Elmslie
creditline: Gift of funds from Kenneth and Judy Dayton
description: 1/4 in. to 1 foot scale model ot the Purcell-Cutts House in two toned wood encased in a plexi vitrine on a wood plinth
medium: Maple, maple veneer, plexiglas, nylon screen
text: The house that William Gray Purcell designed for his family has a long, narrow plan, a 30-foot setback from the sidewalk, and walls of windows—very different from the homes of his neighbors, who “never wholly got used to it,” according to Purcell. Making the most of the narrow 50-by-150-foot city lot pushed Purcell and his architectural partner George Elmslie to their creative limits. The result is their most ambitious residential design. This model depicts the house around 1915, two years after the Purcells moved in.
title: Architectural model
